meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside my window did upstir my curiosity.
meanings.sent2: She upstirred the sleeping dog by calling its name.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act upstirred the audience's amazement.
meanings.sent4: His speech upstirred a wave of emotions in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies upstirred memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: To cause a commotion or disturbance
meanings.sent1: The unexpected announcement upstirred chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The protest upstirred the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel upstirred laughter among the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her arrival upstirred a whirlwind of gossip in the office.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm upstirred fear in the hearts of the villagers.

meanings.sent1: His words upstirred anger in his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The controversial article upstirred a debate among readers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child upstirred his sister by hiding her toys.
meanings.sent4: The political scandal upstirred protests across the country.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk upstirred determination in the team.

meanings.definition: To awaken or arouse from sleep
meanings.sent1: The alarm clock upstirred me from my deep slumber.
meanings.sent2: The chirping birds upstirred the entire household at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon upstirred my brother from his nap.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunder upstirred the baby from her nap.
meanings.sent5: The urgent phone call upstirred me from my afternoon nap.
